DOC.brief_summary: The objectives of the study are to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and effectiveness of NUEDEXTA capsules containing 20 mg DM (Dextromethorphan)/10 mg Q (Quinidine) for treatment of Pseudobulbar Affect (PBA) in patients with prevalent conditions such as dementia, stroke, and traumatic brain injury (TBI)over a 12 week period.
DOC.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability and Effectiveness of Nuedexta in the Treatment of Pseudobulbar Affect (PBA)
DOC.detailed_description: This will be an Open-label, Multicenter, study in patients with PBA and dementia, stroke or TBI. Patients with a clinical diagnosis of PBA and who meet all other inclusion and exclusion criteria will be eligible to participate and receive NUEDEXTA for 12 weeks. Males and females patients with a minimum age of 18 years, a clinical diagnosis of Pseudobulbar Affect and a documented diagnosis of neurologic disease or brain injury, will be enrolled in this study. The primary effectiveness endpoint is the mean change in the Center for Neurologic Study-Lability scale (CNS-LS). Secondary objectives include measures to evaluate treatment outcomes.
DOC.criteria: Center for Neurologic StudyLability Scale (CNSLS)score of 13 or greater Clinical diagnosis of Pseudobulbar Affect (PBA) Documentation of Neurologic disease or brain injury Unstable neurologic disease Severe dementia Stroke within 3 months Penetrating TBI Contraindications to Nuedexta Severe Depressive Disorder
